DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Identification Original Morphology Coding System Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The code that best describes how morphology was originally coded.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cancer Identification Original Morphology Coding System
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The code that best describes how morphology was originally coded.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Identified; having the identity known or established.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
The procedure of having an identity established.

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or being as first made or performed.:Morphology is the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or being as first made or performed.

The science of the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.  In pathology, the specific appearance of cells and tissues (normal and abnormal) under the light or electron microscope.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Fix spelling of DEC Long Name from Cander to Cancer - Dw

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The science of the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.  In pathology, the specific appearance of cells and tissues (normal and abnormal) under the light or electron microscope._The activity of implementing rules that are used to map the elements of one set onto the elements of another set, usually on a one-to-one basis. (from Wikipedia)_a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The activity of implementing rules that are used to map the elements of one set onto the elements of another set, usually on a one-to-one basis. (from Wikipedia):a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The activity of implementing rules that are used to map the elements of one set onto the elements of another set, usually on a one-to-one basis.
A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
